1frog.description: Our baby sign for 'frog' is sticking your tongue out.   Milo can't resist touching his tounge every time it comes out, just to check that it's really doing what he thinks it is.
1frog.title: Frog

aix01.description: After the long long trip to France, we arrived at Babushka's new place, which we hadn't seen before.   It's in a great stone building in the middle of a private garden.
aix01.title: Aix 1

aix02.description: Babushka's door captures the essence of French doors. If you know the Madeline series of books, you'll know they always start with "In an old house in Paris, covered in vines..." Felix took a look at this house and said, "It's covered in vines!"
aix02.title: Aix 2

aix04.description: Milo, as always, is fascinated by everything Felix does.
aix04.title: Aix 4

aix05.description: Twilight chez Babushka is the time for Milo to chase the dozens of semi-wild cats that live around the place.
aix05.title: Aix 5

asse01.description:
After a few days, the show moved to Lucie's cousins' vacation home, in the tiny village of Val d'Asse. Lucie's entire immediate clan was there:
Top: Francoise (Babushka), Jean-Pierre (Lucie's dad), Milo, Felix, Lucie.
Bottom: Caroline (Lucie's half sister), Zoe (Justine's daughter), Justine (Lucie's sister), Iris (Justine's daughter), Yves (Justine's husband).
asse01.title: Asse 1

asse02.description: Nobody but Babushka had met Milo before.  And Felix didn't remember meeting them:  the last time we were in France, he had just turned 1.
asse02.title: Asse 2

asse03.description: Milo loves the crowd.  Oddly, he's stopped using baby signs as much.  I think there's so much to process he's just put it on hold for a while.
asse03.title: Asse 3

asse04.description: Val d'Asse is a tiny village (like maybe 20 people live there).  It's actually on the map, but that's all that distinguishes it from just being a small cluster of houses.   It's in the middle of farms.
asse04.title: Asse 4

asse05.description: Val d'Asse is named so because the river Asse is just a pasture away.  Summers, the Asse dries to a trickle.
asse05.title: Asse 5

bedtime.description: Dean reads Curious George to Iris and Felix.   The book's in English but he's reading in French... but really, a monkey in a cowboy outfit needs no explanation.
bedtime.title: Bedtime

laundry.description:
Signs that Felix is a California boy:
  • He's fascinated by drying clothes on a line.
  • He looked at Yves' cigarette and asked, "What's that?"
laundry.title: Laundry

lunch2.description: Nothing says "I love you" like a plate of prosciutto.
lunch2.title: Lunch 2

lunch3.description: Iris and Felix haven't bonded yet.  They like each other all right, but Iris doesn't understand English.  Felix doesn't get that she doesn't get him, because everyone else understands him, even if they reply in French.  He thinks she's just ignoring him.
lunch3.title: Lunch 3

mizoe.description: Milo and Zoe get along pretty well without words.
mizoe.title: Mizoe

outing.description: A little snack break on an outing.  Milo is happy trailing along after any one of the other three kids.
outing.title: Outing

pool1.description: One of the best features of the house is a swimming pool.
pool1.title: Pool 1

pool2.description: Felix loves the red float thing he's strapped into.  It's impossible to fall out of, and it rights itself.  He can swim all over with it on.
pool2.title: Pool 2

pool4.description: Felix and Lucie discuss penguins.  Felix recently saw a penguin movie and spent a lot of time exiting the pool belly-first, claiming he was the first penguin out of the water.
pool4.title: Pool 4

description: We packed up our strollers and diaper bags and a certain je ne sais quoi and took off for France.  Lucie and the kids are still there, whereas Dean had to return for work after a week and a half.  He'll have the house and all the outdoor cafes in Berkeley to himself for a week, which, in its own way, is a vacation.
title: August 18
